name: Hilton Boston Logan Airport

reviews.text: Needed a hotel in Boston close to the airport and my sister will only stay at 4 stars or above. Boston hotels are very expensive, especially 4+stars. This hotel meet our expectations and more. You can use the hotels courtesy shuttle to the airport or walk via the skybridge. Very easy walk with luggage on wheels. Upon check in we were upgraded to executive level that had awesome views. I was sceptical but the rooms were truely soundproofed for airport traffic-- watched planes taxi and take off but never heard them. We did however hear our neighbor flush toilet more than once. Room to room soundproofing not quite as impressive as the outside noise soundproofing. Courtesy shuttle was also more than willing to drop us off at subway. Very helpful staff. Clean room, nice amenities. Food very expensive and not worth it. In room coffee was surprisingly good. Beds were not very comfortable. We had just come from a few days at a Marriott and they have very comfortable beds. Had been advised there is a charge to use business center computers, however bellman told us we could print boarding passes for free at computer next to elevator. There is a 24 hour dunkin donuts in the airport. Easy to walk over via skybridge and get coffee and donuts anytime day or night. Definately recommend this hotel if you need a hotel near airport.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: I have had two wonderful stays at the Boston Airport Hilton. Both times, my Hilton Honors Diamond VIP status was recognized and rewarded with nice rooms on the executive (top) floor. The desk clerk also gave me free parking when I asked about how the parking worked – not a Diamond benefit, but a much appreciated gesture. They have a wonderful lounge with friendly staff and a great view of the Boston skyline across the harbor. The restaurant in the lobby had nice regional tavern fare and friendly efficient service when I was there for dinner on my second stay.
reviews.title: Great Stays Twice Now

reviews.text: I would like to have spent some more time there (both visits were quick over nights) which says a lot about an airport hotel. They seem to have a nice gym. I should do more of that a less of the exec lounge cookies – four last time!!!
reviews.title: Convenient & comfortable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Landed at Logan and walked across the bridge to the hotel. Incredibly convenient (although the walk from Terminal E to the bridge is a decent hike with luggage) - but within 10 minutes, I was checked in and up in my room. Great room, good pub in the lobby, and service staff were incredibly friendly. Would definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: Despite it's an airport hotel, the underground takes you into town in les than 10 minutes so location is great! A skyway connects it with Terminal A and E. Restaurant was open till late and had a v nice burger after our delayed flight.
reviews.title: One night Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a two day visit to Boston, before flying from the airport. The airport is only 3 miles from the city and the hotel runs a free shuttle to the subway, so access was easy. We stayed in a high room (9th floor) and had fabulous views from the room. We booked and were given an early check in. The hotel bar was OK for food and you get the usual Hilton standards, so we were perfectly happy with the stay.
reviews.title: Nice location

reviews.text: There was a dog barking near my room--on my floor--on and off from before 11pm until well past midnight. Repeated calls the the front desk and management did no good. It seems they sent someone to "check", who stuck their head off the elevator and went back downstairs. All they had to do was stick around for 10 minutes but no, that was asking too much. And I did ask--repeatedly. With an early morning flight, this was most unwelcome.
reviews.title: Hotel Nightmare

reviews.text: To add insult to injury, when I complained to the manager in the morning he suggested I made the whole thing up to get a discount on my bill. Yeah, right. Even it it was my nickel (it was my employer's) I'd much rather get some sleep than get a discount. This was not the first time a Hilton family hotel has demonstrated a complete disregard for customers' sleep, BTW; it seems to "run in the family".
reviews.title: If only other hotels were this good!

likes.disliked: — Can't think of anything off hand... this place is GOOD!

reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel
reviews.text: When we checked in, the guy at the front desk greeted me by name, noted my Hilton diamond status... VERY professional... if only other hotels could be half this professional...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to our excellent room (1057) which has a great view of the airport (although you can't hear a sound) and Boston Harbor beyond...
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed here before but not for some years. Overall I'd say that they've managed to keep the high standards of cleanliness but its definitely lost some gloss.
reviews.title: Can be used as a tourist base to avoid expensive Boston hotels

reviews.text: It IS still easy to get to from terminal E (international arrivals) and its even closer to terminal A. I like being able to walk to a hotel after a flight - it feels relaxing. You can catch the hotel shuttle too if you are feeling less than energetic. If you are arriving via the T get off the shuttle bus/Silver line at Term A for a shorter walk.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.text: We stayed in an exec room on the 10th floor. We decided to use the hotel for a city break and use the T to get to Boston.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel and Services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, the rooms are adequate in size and nicely furnished. Bathroom looked a little bit tired compared to what I remember but nothing bad. It was very clean. The worst part of the room was that we had a connecting door. This meant that on one night we could hear *everything* our neighbours did/talked about. They arrived late, were very noisy and were the same again very early in the morning - at all costs avoid rooms with a connecting door in order to ensure a good night's sleep! We had no trouble on the other evenings we stayed.
reviews.title: Convenient location

reviews.text: The room has everything you need - iron/board, robes, slippers, coffee maker (lavazza coffee), Large flat screen TV (didn't use so cannot comment on quality or channel choice), radio/alarm, phones, safe and laptop tray. You cannot hear any aircraft noise which is amazing.
reviews.title: Easy access to both airport and city

reviews.text: I've stayed here many times over the last 12 years and I was here again for 2 nights over the weekend 26-28 July. This was the first time that I stayed without Hhonors status and it really made a difference. I noticed that the exec lounge is no longer opened over the weekend - but since it was getting very stale with poor service I don't think this is a huge loss.
reviews.title: Stayed many times. Now seeing a general decline in service and standards...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a King size room which was allocated to me after a fairly speedy check in. I have received upgrades to the 2 exec levels (top 2 floors) during previous stays but not this time. The room was OK - but definitely getting a little grubby. Carpets in halls and room could do with a deep clean. The room (7th floor) was functional but not anything special. Windows need cleaning asap.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Poor Dining Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping was very poor for a so-called 4 star hotel - shampoo, conditioner, toilet rolls, tea, coffee and coffee cups were not replenished at all which meant I had to wait for this to be done (without apology) when I was trying to get ready for an evening function. There was no pen or notepad in the room. One of the phones did not work either. Basic stuff and it shouldn't need me to ring reception to get it sorted out.
reviews.title: Great for Terminal A - but just an average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I ate in the Berkshires Restaurant for breakfast. The breakfast buffet was OK but certainly wasn't worth the $21 / $22 it cost (that's the cost without the obligatory 20% service tip - for serving yourself no less!)
reviews.title: QUIET EFFICIENT LOGAN HILTON

reviews.text: Two of us also ate in Connelly's pub which is just off the atrium - this was much worse than I remembered - I had a onion burger, my colleague had fish and chips - we had 2 Sam Adams beers each too. Again, with tip, the bill came to $80. Very poor value for money given the quality of the food. My advice would be to go back downtown to eat where there are much nicer places than gloomy, grubby Connelly's.
reviews.title: Best Airport Hotel!

reviews.text: Last minute booking with no problems. The hotel is right at the Boston Logan Airport and can be accessed from the gates by walkway. I came into Terminal B and it was about a 10 minute walk, all indoors through walkways and through Terminal A, and it was not difficult to find. It appears to be new. Although it is it at the airport, I did not hear a single jet take off or land, which I was concerned about when I booked.
reviews.title: Convenient, clean and comfortable

likes.disliked: — Had to pay extra for wireless internet connection.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was quick and easy (I came in at 11:00 and there were only a couple people waiting at the check in desk) and the assistant at the front desk was pleasant. The room was a good size, very clean and very comfortable. I particularly appreciated the HD television and HD Channels. I also liked the night light in the bathroom, of which I had not seen a similar one before. It was its own "outlet" and gave off a very low blue glow when the light was turned off - not bright enough to be seen in the bedroom, and just light enough to let you see the floor as you walked into the bathroom in the middle of the night, so that you could easily find the light switch without banging a toe, or worse.
reviews.title: As always, excellent Value

reviews.text: My view was of the road coming into the airport, but I wasn't looking for a good view given my limited time there. It looked like there were potential for some nice views of the harbor from other rooms. The lobby is large and well appointed, and we used a conference room that was clean, well appointed and had convenient power plug ins for computers located within the tables and out of the way.
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.text: The only negative I have about the hotel is that you have to pay for the wireless internet connection. I personally believe that today all hotels, and particularly hotels catering to business people, should not only have wireless internect connection, but it should free (at least build it into the cost of the room).
reviews.title: Wonderful send off

likes.disliked: — I can't think of anything I particularly disliked

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One last positive. I had to cancel my second night stay and check out about 15 minutes after noon. The hotel did not charge me for the second night or charge a late cancellation fee without me asking. I really do appreciate that and I consider that good service.
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel

reviews.text: Great staff, great location, great service. Not much else to say about that. Walking to the airport through the skyway or take the shuttle. Great hotel. I have stayed here several times and it ranks in my top 5 hotels to stay at in the country. As a business traveler, the gym is great, the bar is good (food and drink) and the location can't be beat. I have enjoyed every stay here.
reviews.title: Great hotel for the business traveler!

reviews.text: After a very late (1AM) flight arriving at Terminal B, I was able to walk (via the central parking garage) to the Hilton. A very friendly person at the front desk checked me in, and off to a comfortable room on the Executive Floor. The lounge opened at 5:30AM, so I had a light breakfast before walking to Terminal C for my early morning flight. Although I missed using the other faciltities of the Hilton this time around, the relatively short distance between terminal and room meant more time on vacation.
reviews.title: Location,Location, Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had to catch an early flight on July 5th, but we wanted to see the 4th of July fireworks without having a really crowded late night. Shirley at the front desk was great, reassuring us that the fireworks could be seen from the hotel (city/harbor side) which was true. We were able to see the main fireworks as well as as fireworks throughout the city. And then in the morning we were able to walk to the terminal we were leaving from. So convenient. Great service from all hotel staff that we encountered. Nicely appointed hotel room and quiet! One of the critiques that I read about the Hyatt Harborside was that even though the windows were sound proofed, the walls and doors were paper thin. We found this to not be the case at the Hilton and were very satisfied.
reviews.title: Great for early flights AND seeing 4th of July Fireworks

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed over at the Hilton Logan airport hotel last week and it reminded me that this is my favorite airport hotel. Within walking distance to Terminal A/E or a short van ride to B/C, the location is great for easy terminal access.
reviews.title: My favorite airport hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are spacious and comfortable and surprising quiet for being just about on the runway. As a Diamond member of Hilton I have access to the executive lounge- one of the nicest in the fleet. Great views of Boston and the harbor, good snacks, nice breakfast, and friendly service.
reviews.title: Convenient for the airport.

reviews.text: I enjoyed this hotel. The only real problem is that it is not in one of the neigborhoods that allows you to see Boston. However, the cab ride into Boston city is less than 20 dollars - which isn't too bad at all. The rooms were spacious and nice quality and the food and service was good. The menu could have been a little more extensive.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Hilton Logan three times over the last two years. It is a solid hotel with comfortable, clean rooms, completely insulated from the noise of the airport. Its weekend rates can be quite reasonable, especially for Boston.
reviews.title: Solid airport hotel

likes.disliked: — Overpriced food and business center, long waits for shuttles.

reviews.title: Great Service/Hotel
reviews.text: Room service and the restaurants are very, very pricey (presumably since most people who stay there are on expense accounts), and if you arrive at night, there is nowhere else you can go. The breakfast buffet is unexceptional (scrambled eggs, oatmeal, fresh fruit, cereals, sandwich breads and bagels) but decent.

The airport shuttle is irregular; if you call from baggage claim, be sure to go out immediately, since it won't wait around for you. Be aware, however, that you may end up waiting anywhere from two to forty minutes. This hotel could use an extra shuttle since there are times that the wait at the terminal can be very long for a hotel that is right on airport premises.
reviews.title: Great Stay @ the Hilton Logan

reviews.text: That said, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who needs to overnight at the airport, particularly if you can get a price that's $150-200 range. And remember to eat before you arrive.
reviews.title: Awesome for the price and convenience
Disappointing
reviews.text: My experience was disappointing. While the room was nice and clean, the services were failing. The room service took forever, they accidentally charged us for the services we never received, and I had my clothes stolen in the gym locker room and they have taken no action. I would not recommend it to my friends or family.

Stayed with family on holiday for 5 nights, booked solely for convenience to avoid a long trek with bags into Town following a long flight. Superb hotel, totally insulated from sound of airport, excellent rooms, comfortable beds, plasma HD TV in rooms. Staff all competent and friendly. Executive lounge on 10th floor great for views and free snacks am and pm. Shuttles regular and reliable, never had to wait more than a minute. Pool was a bit cold, but otherwise highly recommended, and not too expensive when booked direct.
reviews.title: excellent

likes.disliked: — locatrio, not in town but easy to get there and back

reviews.text: Stopped for one night having arrived in to Boston just before midnight on a late flight. The handy link walkway to the hotel is misleading although it does have one if you happen to be in the right
reviews.title: Handy Walkway from the Airport a bit Misleading

reviews.text: terminal. We probably dragged our suitcases a couple of miles around the airport and car park. It would have been easier to just get a taxi outside the terminal to the front door of the hotel.
reviews.title: They Do It Right

likes.liked: — Unexpected luxury at a hotel airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then to find that the room we had booked had been given out because we had arrived late...........no suprise there we told them on our booking request, we just felt that the staff didnt care whether we stopped or not.
reviews.title: Lovely stay on executive floor

reviews.text: I ordered a room service and thought they send me Asian steam bums instead of bread, only found a mouthful of liquid dough, so disgusting!!! (I could down load a picture of it). I called room service, no one answering, and call front desk, and forwarded to many "living" staff until an answer machine. No one is doing anything or saying anything except for forwarding my call to the next "living" staff. This is the service I got after giving additional 25% tip for room delivery. The place is only a bit above 60F, so cold, and I told front desk and other staff if they could reduce the use of AC, only get a stare from an male Asian staff, and no response from others. Never ever stay in any Hilton or related in my life time!!! I just cancelled my reservation in Santa Rosa,. Don't want them to ruin my trip in wine country and my business trip.
reviews.title: Nightmare in Hilton Boston Airport

reviews.text: Attractive hotel, clean rooms with very comfortable beds, and a nice (thought pricey) breakfast buffet. The hotel is about a 5 minute indoor walk from terminal A and about a 10-minute indoor walk from terminal E, so a very convenient location. Their shuttle will take you to the T station to get into Boston - coming back you can take one of the airport shuttles to either terminal A or E and then have a short walk.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in Great Location

reviews.text: This is one of two higher end hotels within a shuttle bus ride of the airport. One nice feature of this hotel is that it is actually a five minute walk (all enclosed) from Terminal A. The hotel shuttle bus runs every 15 minutes. The rooms are standard, modern, clean and they are quiet. There is a great little cafe where one can grab a quick coffee and pastry to go in the morning. However, I am not a fan of the restaurant as I think it is over-priced and quite noisy. If you head into Boston, you can actually take a shuttle from the airport or the hotel shuttle and then board a water taxi to the financial district. The boat ride is about 10 minutes. It is spectacular and it sure beats going through the tunnel.
reviews.title: A Good Airport Hotel

reviews.text: Spent nearly $1200 to stay there and they wanted to chage extra to check-out an hour later. Rooms are dated and furniture uncomfortable. Resteraunt food and room service is outrageous. Cheap and better to take subway downtown.
reviews.title: 5 nights business stay
Hilton Hotel Logan Airport
reviews.text: Excellent in all respects. Very convenient to subway to go anywhere in Boston. Staff were all very polite and welcoming. Only downside was that it was a deceptively long walk from baggage claim to the hotel--all indoor, but the hotel bills itself as "inside the airport"

I stayed at the Hilton 2 nights this past month...once en route to Rome from Seattle and then again on the way back. Both rooms were comfortable, quiet and equipped with everything I wanted for a restful night. It was easy to get to the hotel via their shuttles, and the 5-minute distance to the terminals can't be beat.
reviews.title: Great place for a between-flight rest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent some time in the health club and steam room...a nice bonus after a long trip...and had some mixed results from Room Service and Berkshires restaurants. All in all, a perfectly good place to rest before, after or between flights.
reviews.title: Liked it a lot

likes.disliked: — Having to wait for the shuttle to come pick us up at the T

reviews.title: dirty room
reviews.text: Got this hotel for $100/night through Hotwire. Worth the $$ for the stay, but not if you pay full price. There is a shuttle that takes you from the hotel to the airport and to the T. The front desk service was slow, and I was disappointed that they did not have any aspirin when I asked for some. The room we stayed in "Corner Deluxe King" was WONDERFUL. Great view and TOTALLY quiet.

reviews.title: Perfect !
reviews.text: Great location if you are taking an early morning flight as we were. Of course it helps if you get your 5.30 wake up call which we did not. (we had a cell phone call as a back up).

Main problem was how dirty the room was. It appeared to have been used by someone else to some extent. bits of food on the chair. note pad and pen used. Toilet seat up. In particular the floor was littered and it hadnt been vacuumed at all.
reviews.title: Great service - good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right next to the airport, this hotel is fantastic. It is large, clean, spacious, and the rooms are nice. The front desk staff was amiable and helpful. The fitness center is terrific and the club room is great with hot food & drinks and flat screen tvs. Overall we had a terrific stay and look forward to staying here again before an early morning flight.
reviews.title: Terrific Hotel

reviews.text: Right at the airport with shuttles running every 10 to 15 mins. Great Exeuctive floor. Rooms are above normal standards. Hotel food was good. Best cheese steak since philly (except for the bread).
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: After a frustrating day of late arrivals, missed connections and a flight cancellation, US Air rewarded me with a night at the Hilton - and it was (almost) worth the delay. This is a beautiful and surprisingly quiet hotel located on the airport property. I enjoyed a nice meal downstairs before retiring in a well appointed, clean and comfortable room. The hotel shuttled me back to the gate in time for my 7 a.m. flight. I would consider staying here again - even without the flight delays.
reviews.title: Nice Consolation After Flight Cancellation

likes.disliked: — The flat-screen T.V. remote, etc. was difficult to master!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed overnight after flight cancellation. Checked in late but plenty of staff and meal available if we had wanted it. Lively Connolly's Pub within the hotel. Reasonable size room with all you need (including large flat screen TV) except for in room safe.
reviews.title: Excellent Airport Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good variety of choice at breakfast. Not the cheapest but value for money.
reviews.title: Best "in airport" hotel.
Low water pressure, irregular water temperature
reviews.text: My husband and I are well traveled, and stay in high-end hotels all over the U.S. and internationally. We usually choose Marriott because of the consistency of cleanliness and comfort. We needed to stay close to the airport, and the closest Marriott was in town. I read very positive reviews on TripAdvisor for this airport hotel, so we booked the Hilton @ $199/nite (regular room, 2 dbls) for 3 nites. Upon entering the room, which faced the Boston skyline and harbor, I did not find it to be a large room, but rather standard. This was probably due to 2 dbl beds in the room, which, by the way, were small for doubles. I was informed all rooms were the same size, unless you booked a suite. I did not find it to be very clean. I had to wipe down the light switches, as they were filthy with caked-on dirt and finger prints. Carpets were dirty, and furniture was dusty. Once cleaned, it would be ok, but the real bothersome part of our stay was the low water pressure in the shower and the very old showerhead. Also, the water would go from warm to cold to scalding hot. Terrible.

I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone considering a visit to Boston. Whilst not in the downtown area it is incredibly easy to travel in and out of the city centre. The hotel shuttle runs throughout the day and we never had to wait more than 10 minutes for a bus. The bus takes you directly to the Airport T station from where it is a short ride into the centre of Boston and all the key sights. An alternative way to travel would be to walk into the airport terminal and get the Silverline T which is a bus - this goes via the Conference centre (not Hynes but the other one!). During our stay there seemed to be a lot of attendees from the Microsoft Conference but this didn't cause us any problems. We found the service at the Irish Bar to be prompt and good - the food is okay too.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay

reviews.text: The hotel leisure club facilities were very good - the water pressure in the showers at the pool was much better than that in our room. Being Hilton Members we received a room upgrade and got a great end of corridor/corner room with fantastic views of Boston and the harbour (7th Floor). We were also able to use the Club Lounge which provides a continental breakfast. No problems with housekeeping encountered.
reviews.title: very convenient

reviews.text: Reserved rooms for two visits through BOS May and June 2006.
reviews.title: Almost Pleasant Experience

reviews.text: It was very convenient to the car rentals and the flights. Bar open late for real food.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Used this hotel for an overnight stay after arriving in Boston and before heading off the next day. It is connected to the airport, at least from the international arrivals, via a somewhat convoluted walkway, (there is also a shuttle, which i did not spot!) but fairly easy to find. Room was good. I had a meal in the "traditional" Irish pub which was good. As far as airport hotels go this was above average and fairly reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Great for after a long flight...

reviews.text: Although we live in the Greater Boston area, we have stayed at this hotel many times. Usually we use it because our flight to wherever is so early in the morning that it would be impossible to get someone to drop us off, or I am too cheap to pay for a full week of garaging my truck. The hotel is a stone's throw from the airport and has a very dependable shuttle. The food at the restaurant is pretty good pub style fare, and it is a very relaxing atmosphere. The rooms are very nice and well appointed. Views can be achieved but for our purposes not neccessary and never asked for. For what we need it for, this Hilton goes above and beyond the call.
reviews.title: Perfect for the weary traveler

reviews.text: The hotel is five star and very convenient to downtown via metro rail and the airport. There is a bridge from the hotel to the airport terminal A & B. There is also a shuttle. If you're beyond Terminal B, I'd recommend taking the shuttle instead because of the long walk. The restaurant is convenient but pricey. I'd recommend going to the Northside instead because they have a lot of very good Italian places there. When I travel to Boston I always stay here if I can and had never been disappointed. I return my rental car though and just take the metro to go around.
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel!

reviews.text: Let's face it. Airport hotels exist primarily for overnight transients. They are not dolled up for the tourist trade...unless, of course, the airport is also near the touristy areas of the city. That is certainly not the case with Boston's Logan airport.
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise for an airport hotel

reviews.text: But the Logan Hilton was a fabulous surprise. From its lovely towering lobby to its spacious, well appointed rooms and it's pleasant staff, the only downside it that this is not a downtown hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location, Comfortable Stay

reviews.text: This was a repeat visit to this hotel for our family. We got a great rate by pre-paying for the night through our AAA office. This is a great hotel if you have an early flight out of Logan. Room was clean and well appointed. Health spa is really quite nice with excellent equipment. Staff is friendly. You can walk to Logan through a skyway system. We took the shuttle to the T and had dinner in Boston that night. All very easy and probably half the price of a downtown hotel.
reviews.title: Terrific hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on the first night of our honeymoon since we had an early flight the next morning. We arrived very late that evening and check in was fast and easy. They had even chilled a bottle of Champaign since we were on our honeymoon. We had breakfast very early the next morning and that was a very nice start to the long day of traveling.
reviews.title: NIce hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is not as close to the airport as it appears. You can walk over but you are probably better off asking for a ride over to the airport instead of trying to navigate through all the parking lots to the actual terminals.
reviews.title: nice stay

reviews.text: We stayed Jun 22 for one night. Got this hotel at a bargain of $85 a night on Priceline. Room was nice and clean and the decor was nice, not Motel 6 cheesy.
reviews.title: The Hilton was Average

reviews.text: Ate at the Pub downstairs. Disappointed on their seating policy--they don't have a hostess that seats you. You are supposed to walk in and seat yourself. The night we went, flights had been cancelled so the restaurant was full and at least 20 people circling like vultures for an open table. I found the manager and advised to get a waiting list because it was soon going to get ugly. Food was okay for a hotel. Kids loved the indoor heated pool. Would definately stay again.
reviews.title: The best at Boston Logan

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton at Logan Airport while on a business trip with a colleague. We walked to the hotel from the airport in terminal C, which was not as easy to walk as Terminal A is, but was a pleasant walk nonetheless. The skyways all have moving walkways, which makes the trip a lot quicker than it might otherwise seem. We were able to check into our rooms at 10:30 in the morning and then took the hotel shuttle (which runs every 10-15 minutes) to the Silver Line stop to go downtown. It took us about 30 minutes to get from the hotel to downtown and only cost $1.25 each, which was great! The rooms were wonderful and the beds were incredibly comfortable. It was obviously not in the most scenic part of Boston, so if I were traveling for pleasure and sightseeing, I might not stay there, but it really was a great hotel, and I would definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel!

reviews.text: This Hilton was probably one of the nicest Hilton properties that I've stayed in. The hotel is very well kept and has a comfortable and upscale feeling to it. The lobby area is very spacious and everything is close by. I walked to the hotel from the "A" terminal and it was very easy to get to. I arrived earlier in the day however they had a room available to check in to. The room was very spacious and had all the necessary amenities. There was a work desk, two chairs, king size bed, coffee maker, and good bathroom amenities. The bed was extremely comfortable, as it is there new "serenity" bed. The view was of the airport, but they also have rooms facing downtown. The healthclub was small, yet it was a nice touch. The pool was nice, and they also had a hot tub and seperate locker rooms with steam rooms and a sauna. I had a drink at the pub which was a nice place to go relax for a little. I would highly recommend this place to anyone needing to stay near the airport. It would also be good place for tourists, as getting to public transportation is very easy, via the hilton shuttle or walking to the terminals.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hilton Hotel!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Boston Logan Hilton for just one night following a return from Europe. What a wonderful hotel! The room was quite large by anyone's standard and included a big king bed with comfortable pillows and blankets. There was a television in an armoir and included about 30 different free channels. A work desk as well as several lounging chairs were also there. The view overlooked, what else, the airport but who cares. The Hilton is itself connected to terminal E (international arrival/departure) by a raised enclosed walkway. I was able to get to my room in less than 5 minutes walk after exiting customs!
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, everything perfect . . .
Good for an Early AM Flight
reviews.text: I did use the healthclub which is on the lobby floor. Probably not so great a location as I hate to walk across a lobby in gym shorts. Oh well. I ate at their sports-type restaurant and found the food and service quite good as well.

Free internet access is located at a computer workstation in the lobby. Wifi access is an additional charge. Free shuttles also take you to any of the terminals as well as several locations in greater Boston.
reviews.title: Great one night stay

reviews.text: this hotel is an excellent place to stay i stayed 2 nights and was very impressed, shuttle service is brilliant,staff friendly and rooms fab.right next to airport but no noise whatsoever,very quiet,would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: super hotel

reviews.text: I needed to stay in Boston the night before flying to California and the Hilton was great. Very comfortable room, very friendly staff, no problems, everything comfortable. Used the shuttle to get to the T to go downtown and meet some friends for dinner and that worked great. The hotel is a shlep from the terminal through acres of parking garage, but the shuttle serves the terminals. I liked being able to walk though.
reviews.title: Perfect for gentle start to a trip

likes.disliked: — at the airport but still an unattractive shlep to the terminal

reviews.text: I stayed there in the middle of June, one night before a flight home. I had stayed there in March and had a fairly good stay at that time. I checked in at about 3 PM. As I walked to my room,which was the very last unit on the fourth floor, the hall way was lined with at least two dozen used room service trays from the night before.
reviews.title: Rat!

reviews.text: I got into my room and sat on the bed for a while watching TV. Out of the corner of my eye I saw movement. I looked over at the air conditioning vent, which is on the lower part of the wall against the window, just in time to see the back half of a rat crawl out of my room and into the vent! Folks, I grew up on the corner of a farm and I assure you that I know the difference between a rat and a mouse. Mice don't have long tails and they are not the size of a hamster. Surely all the dishes I saw out in the hall were the rat buffet.
reviews.title: Reasonably priced for downtown boston--not a bad place to stay

reviews.text: I called the front desk, and they changed my room, but they were not very much more accommodating then just giving me a pass to the executive club for the day. While the front desk guy was appologetic, what he didn't seem was suprized!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Convenient to Airport, More coffee please

reviews.text: stopped here for a short night.
reviews.title: solid quality

reviews.text: Friendly welcome, quality beds in quality rooms - not the newest, but well maintained.
reviews.title: Great airport hotel - especially for business meetings

reviews.text: Stopped in lounge for quick early breakfast - quality porridge and coffee, smiles in the morning.
reviews.title: Great place to stay at Boston Airport

reviews.text: Conveniently connected to some terminals by walkway, shuttle to others.
reviews.title: Awesome airport hotel

reviews.text: If you need to fly people together fur a meeting on the east coast, this hotel is a great choice.
reviews.title: Beautiful and convenient

reviews.text: I stayed here for the night before an early morning flight. The beds were very comfortable, bathroom clean with granite counters. Shuttle service ran very early in the morning and the shuttle bus drivers very helpful (even helping me find a place that sold live lobsters late at night)
reviews.title: Great hotel for an overnight stay

reviews.text: We stayed at the Airport Hilton one night to avoid late night driving in an unfamiliar territory. It was an excellent choice and a very nice stay. The room was good size, the furnishing attractive and comfortable, the service was excellent and most important, the hotel was quiet even with the busy airport traffic. Recommend using the hotel shuttle from the airport as it is only a 5-10 minute wait. The only negative was outdoor parking but, since we didn't have a car yet, it didn't bother us. Many airport hotels can be recommended only because of their location. This is an exception.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice

reviews.text: Well, my flight got cancelled on Monday so company checked us into the Hilton for only 1 night. This hotel (although an airport hotel) was FABULOUS, the amenities included (serenity bed, steamroom, sauna, lappool) were all fabulous. The resteraunts within the hotel were VERY good for an airport hotels food. The manager was excellent and very much cared about his job and choosen careerpath. I traveled with a group of travel agents and we all agreed this was the best airport hotel we have ever stayed.
reviews.title: TravelAgent Review

reviews.text: Check it out, for even more than 1 night you will NOT be dissapointed.
reviews.title: Nice view of Boston

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location. It is not downtown but you can walk to all airport terminals via covered bridges and from there take a free shuttle bus to the Boston subway station and be downtown in minutes. Rooms that face Boston have a great view of the city skyline, harbour and surrounding areas. The pool was a small but well staffed. The hotel bar was average.
reviews.title: Our first trip to Boston

reviews.text: Wow! We got a room here via Priceline for about $100 and were blown away by the quality of accommodations here, from the bellhop to the restaurant to the room itself. Spacious, sparkling clean room and bathroom, nice Crabtree & Evelyn products, comfy bed, HD television in the room. Although there was construction going on in one of the hotel restaurants, we were quickly seated in the other one and received great service and surprisingly good food. This is a great value and I would even consider staying there during a regular Boston visit (not just to catch an early flight!)
reviews.title: Fantastic, far beyond expectations

reviews.text: This is a great hotel. I got stuck in Boston due to a flight cancel and picked this hotel because it is at the airport. I didn't care if it was nice or not, but I was pleasantly surprised. Here are the pros/cons:
reviews.title: Great Hotel
We had a wonderful stay at this hotel
reviews.text: Pros:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Everything about this place is nice and new! It has a beautiful, huge lobby and at the end of the hallway on each floor are two chairs/table that you can sit and look out into the Boston Harbor - very nice.
reviews.title: Decent on Airport Hotel

likes.liked: — Comfort level and quietness, freindly staff
likes.disliked: — a much further walk to the terminal than tou'd think.

reviews.text: 2. The furnishings and decor in the rooms are top-notch. There is even a huge LCD HDTV in the room - and you get HD programming.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Nice airport hotel within walking distance of terminal
reviews.title: Good Airport Hotel
Great Hotel, Helpful Staff, Great Location
reviews.text: Stayed on the Club Floor which was excellent

This hotel is right next to Logan Airport and has a frequent shuttle service. They are good at adapting to schedule changes, flight issues, and emergencies. Good food in the restaurants (there really isn't another option for eating close by). ROoms are clean and quiet. Well appointed.
reviews.title: Very reasonable place

reviews.text: I only stayed in this hotel for a night before flying out to San Francisco the next day. The flight was early so decided to stay here instead of staying in downtown.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for Minimal Stay

likes.liked: — The convenience of getting into Boston.

reviews.text: Had driven from Albany and returned the car to the Avis rental place without a hassle.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel
Overall Good Experience
reviews.text: Hilton Hotel was very nice...beds very comfy, shuttle service was on time and wonderful to get to the "T" walls are very thin at 3 am in the morning I woke up to the people next door chit chatting...that was frustrating...it was difficult to get back to sleep...

make sure you get the side of the hotel with the view of the water and Boston...much better than the highway view...One thing I wish the hotel had was a conceige desk in the lobby...especially for questions as to what restaurants to go to, or directions somewhere...they have you ask the bellman but he is too busy with people coming and going that it seemed like he didn't want to be bothered with answering those kind of questions...most hotels have a separate stand for a conceige...
reviews.title: Excelelnt hotel

likes.liked: — The coffee stand in the hotel is really poor quality.

reviews.text: Overall, it was a nice expereince...rooms are clean...
reviews.title: Perfect One Night Stay

likes.liked: — Its close proximity to the airport and room quality

reviews.text: This is a great hotel. Extremely clean, modern, and really comfortable. The beds are as luxurious as any other hotel I've stayed in. There is no airport noise, surprisingly. The lobby is very grand. The rooms are meticulous and the bathrooms very clean. All in all, an excellent place.
reviews.title: Didnt want Logan area but it turned out OK anyway.

reviews.text: My family and I recently stayed one night using points before flying out the next morning.
reviews.title: Very Good!!!

likes.liked: — Great clean room. Outside sitting area.

reviews.text: The hotel is ideal for an overnight prior to moving on after a flight, or staying the night before flying. If I was staying in Boston I would not use the hotel due to the location. The staff are very pleasant and helpful, and the rooms very clean.
reviews.title: Overnigting in Boston
Clean & comfy but no free Wifi
reviews.text: Nice amenities, lovely sheets feel so good after rough airline seats, but many taxes inflate the bill and lack of free wifi is annoyint at this price. There is a pool kids pool kids like, unlike other airport choice. The shuttle service is quick and good and covers the T, car rental sites, etc.

This was an easy choice when stay/flying out of logan airport. I recommend staying at the Hilton--transportation to your gate was fast and easy. It was worth the extra dollars to stay -have dinner and sleep at the Hilton /Logan.
reviews.title: Great
Perfect for the layover and close to the heart of the city.
reviews.text: The Boston Airport Hilton is the perfect location to rest and relax during a layover at Logan. It has all the amenities needed and more. Getting to and from the city is fast and convieneant by water or land taxi. The rooms are spacious, clean and very comfortable. I only wish i had more time to enjoy this hotel which i'm sure i will stay at again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The accommodations were excellent as we were in transit to and from our trip to Iceland. The availability of internet and printing enabled us to keep up with our email and print tickets. The Shuttle was frequent and convenient.
reviews.title: Airport Hotel

reviews.text: I had a very early flight from Boston and had been looking for a good hotel near Logan. Everything was up in the $300 range so I decided to try Priceline and was shocked that I got the Hilton for $90!!! This is an above-average Hilton. The lobby is airy and immediately inviting. Check-in (and check-out) was quick and friendly.
reviews.title: Solid airport hotel--exceptional for the price

likes.liked: — Close to Logan, lives up to Hilton name
likes.disliked: — The walkway, but it's really not a big deal

reviews.text: I was given room 360-- a smoking room as I'd requested. I understand the anti-smoking issues, but I admire Hilton for still accommodating those of us who can't quite kick the habit. The room was large, sleek, clean and had a nice view of Boston. The tv was brand new, flat-panel with great resolution, although the choice of channels was a bit limited (about 25) when compared to some other hotels. I couldn't quite master the a/c system which I set at 68 but kept bouncing back to 74. It didn't matter much because the glass captured the cold outside, but on a hot day, I would've called maintenance.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

likes.liked: — Very comfy beds! Nice lobby area witha great coffee shop.

reviews.text: I ordered room service, chicken quesadilla and a turkey panini with fries. The food was good quality, especially the fries which tasted fresh-cut. It wasn't a culinary extravaganza, but it did the job.
reviews.title: Excellent value; Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the walkway to the airport, it's really only useful if you're flying in/out of terminal A (Delta). Otherwise, use the hotel shuttle which runs 24 hours.
reviews.title: Great anniversary night!

likes.liked: — easy access to Boston and the Boston airport

reviews.text: Highly recommended hotel for travelers needing to stay near Logan.
reviews.title: Dependable Hilton

likes.disliked: — have to pay to go to/from Boston through the tunnels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Hilton at Boston Logan Airport every year during our annual trip to the Carribean. The skywalk is a great alternative to the hotel shuttle however the shuttle does run every 10-15 minutes. Check in was easy and pleasant. We ordered room service which was VERY good, it arrived on time and hot. We had a very early flight out the next morning and the "ZIP CHECKOUT" made our departure all the easier. One call to an automated line and we were on our way. I was a tad concerned when we returned as our flight was delayed and we didnt get in until 1:00 a.m. I had not requested a late check and was concerned that perhaps they didn't hold our room. No need to worry, they did. Even at 1:00 a.m. they had plenty of front desk staff to attend to us as well as other travelers. Room service was even available at that hour and again the food arrived on time and hot. The Hilton is a nice resting spot in between flights and we will stay there again in the future.
reviews.title: Nice resting spot
Very comfortable place; ideal if you have an early a.m. flight
reviews.text: I am staying here for 1 night at this hotel because I have an early morning flight. It is about a 7-10 minute walk from Terminal A to the hotel lobby (signs are everywhere so you don't get lost). If you have heavy bags, just be aware it is a little bit of a walk. Front desk was very courteous--no offer to help with bags, but then again, I like that (less I have to tip), and I'm sure they would have helped if I asked. Executive level floor has nice rooms, free bottled water, coffee maker, and flat panel TV. My room looks out to Terminal A, it's neat watching the planes take off and land. Quality bath products (crabtree and evelyn), and the robe is a nice touch. Room service was prompt--good food for a hotel restaurant. I don't know why hotels of this quality make you pay for Internet (and for the money you pay), that's my only complaint.

reviews.title: Relaxation at Boston Logan
reviews.text: Generally I approach airport hotels with low expectations as they always seem to be disappointing in at least one regard, however my recent stay at the Hilton Boston Logan Airport was thankfully disappointment free!

In terms of getting to the Hotel, if you've got a lot of luggage I would suggest getting the courtesy shuttle to the hotel as the walk (through two or three skywalks) is fairly lengthy - easily 10 minutes at a brisk pace. When approaching from the airport skywalks you arrive on an upper level which houses a number of meeting rooms and looks out over the main lobby area. Although there was nothing going on in the meeting rooms, I noticed a couple of hotel maintenance staff cleaning the area.
reviews.title: Nice airport hotel

likes.liked: — it's a higher grade hotel connected right to the airport

reviews.text: When I got to the checkin desk there was a line of 3 people ahead of me. There were three staff on the checkin desk and one member of staff greeting people in the line and apologising for the delay...a delay which lasted about 2-3 minutes! During the checkin process I was given a choice of rooms (which I thought was a nice touch) and informed about the hotel facilities.
reviews.title: Great hotel at Logan - and so convenient ...

likes.liked: — View of Boston from the room

reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay here. It was a business trip and I was a bit worried about being out of it by the airport but the combination of the excellent accommodation, shuttles to the subway and excellent subway infrastructure made this a superb stay. There is a good Irish bar within the hotel, a good gym and pool, good rooms and overall a very nice hotel. If I went back to Boston I would stay there.
reviews.title: Airport hotels are rubbish.... don't believe it - this one was excellent!!!!

likes.disliked: — A waiter called my room at midnight saying I didn't leave a tip!!!!

reviews.text: My Minneapolis flight came in very late and I booked a stay instead of driving over an hour home at midnight.
reviews.title: Spectacular

likes.disliked: — Too far from downtown Boston if a tourist

reviews.text: What a beautiful hotel. It is easy to find through a catwalk at the airport. They also provde a shuttle if you dont want to walk.
reviews.title: The Good, The Bad, and The Dusty
Go for the Exec Level...
reviews.text: In the lobby there is a nice pub and all business amenities.
The room is absolutely beautiful, new furniture, updated, with a pretty view of the airport and water.
reviews.title: Very Good but not Excellent

likes.liked: — Connected to the airport, Hilton Quality
likes.disliked: — If you pay more than $200 per night then its not value for money

aka: Hilton Boston Logan Airport Hotel Boston
